DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2021-6-9 ak Released per governance approval.; Created as part of the CDISC mapping task_ghd_08.24.18

ValueDomain.preferredName: Drug Accountability Record Subcategorization Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A sub-division of the drug accountability classification._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: A sub-division of the drug accountability classification.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/25/20 Created to support sponsor defined codelists; tmt.
ValueDomain.administrativeNotes: 07.14.22_Released during quarterly metrics and per request from G. Riley_ghd

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the name of the trea
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the name of the treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If it is known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate, but different than DACAT, grouping values). See SDTMIG V3.2 DA domain for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DASCAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the name of the study treatment dispensed/returned (e.g., Bottle A, Bottle B).

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 07.14.22_Released as part of the quarterly metrics and per request of G. Riley_ghd
